title: General Support
description: The place for discussing ideas, questions, and help in general. For Fundamental and Specific lessons. For Newbie, Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced, and Expert levels.

title: Careers, Skills, and Principles
description: The professional careers, skills, and principles. Stuffs like life, work, health, management, and communication. Could be related to Science, Technology, Reading, Writing, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics.

title: Projects and Products
description: The implementation of website and application in general for any scale (tiny, small, medium, large, huge).

title: Business
description: The business-side of technology by making products or services. Related to startups and SaaS (Software as a Service) business.

title: Graphic Design
description: The graphics for general purpose. Including typography, logo, icon, photos, illustration, and animation.

title: UI/UX and Web Design
description: The UI (User Interface) and UX (User Experience) aspects for website, web app, and mobile app. Including things from graphic design, with layout and typography.

title: Website Development
description: The actual creation of website. Combination of HTML and CSS to apply an existing UI/UX of a web design. Including browser developer tools.

title: Web App Development
description: The implementation of web application using web programming languages and platforms such as JavaScript, TypeScript, and Node.js. With any ECMAScript versions. Including debuggers.

title: Apple
description: Apple-related stuffs such as macOS, Macbook, iMac, iOS, iPhone, and iPad.

title: Linux
description: Linux-related such as Android, Ubuntu, Fedora, Linux Mint, elementary OS, Arch Linux, and others.

title: Windows
description: Microsoft Windows-related stuffs.

title: Web Browsers
description: Web browser-related such as Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Brave, Chromium, Microsoft Edge, and others. Including the developer tools.

title: Design Tools
description: Design tool-related such as Figma, Framer, Sketch, InVision, Marvel, Adobe XD, and others. Including more specific ones like Zeplin and Origami.

title: Code Editors
description: Code editor and IDE (Integrated Development Environment) related such as VS Code, Sublime Text, and Atom. Including their derivatives like CodeSandbox, CodePen, Glitch, Replit, JSFiddle, and others.

title: Markdown
description: The popular markup for text formatting and documentation like README. Including its derivatives such as MDX. Or alternativs like reStructuredText, AsciiDoc, Textile.

title: Terminal and Shell
description: The app and system to handle CLI (command line interface) stuffs. Including bash, zsh, PowerShell, SSH, and others.

title: Git
description: Git-related stuffs such as Git workflow, GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and others.

title: HTML
description: The main markup of a website.

title: CSS
description: The main styling language of a website.

title: CSS Libraries and Frameworks
description: The classic CSS design utilities and systems like Tailwind, Bootstrap, Foundation, Semantic UI, Bulma, Tachyons, and others.

title: CSS-in-JS
description: The next generation of styling and animation through and usually paired with JavaScript frameworks. Including Emotion, styled-components, Stitches, Framer Motion, Styled System, Chakra UI, and others.

title: Analytics
description: The data from visitors and users. Including Google Analytics, Simple Analytics, Fathom Analytics, Splitbee, and others.

title: JavaScript
description: The main programming language to build a website or web application.

title: TypeScript
description: The superset and type-safe version of JavaScript programming language.

title: Dart
description: The client-optimized programming language for apps on multiple platforms. Including Flutter.

title: Kotlin
description: The Kotlin programming language.

title: Swift
description: The Swift programming language.

title: Python
description: The Python programming language. Including Django and Sinatra.

title: Ruby
description: The Ruby programming language. Including Rails and Flask.

title: Java
description: The Java programming language. Including Spring and JVM (Java Virtual Machine).

title: Go
description: The Go programming language.

title: PHP
description: The PHP programming language. Including its frameworks and platforms such as WordPress, Laravel, Code Igniter, Drupal.

title: C-family
description: The C-family programming languages such as C, C++, C#, Objective-C.

title: Programming Languages
description: The other coding and programming languages such as Elm, Scala, Rust, Clojure, Perl, R, F#, Elixir, Erlang, even BASIC and Assembly.

title: Deployment
description: Deployment-related stuffs and PaaS (Platform as a Service) such as Vercel, Netlify, Heroku, Railway, OpenShift, and others.

title: Node.js
description: The cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment. Including npm and yarn, also things like I/O, file system, and networking.

title: Deno
description: The Node.js alternative.

title: Packages
description: The variety of mostly Node.js packages or modules you can get and use from npm. Including things like formatter (Prettier), static analysis or linter (ESLint), transpiler (Babel), module bundler (Webpack, Rollup), hooks (Husky), and others.

title: React.js
description: The frontend JavaScript library for building UI components. Including Preact, React Router, and React Helmet. Also its derivatives such as React Native, React VR, Expo, and others.

title: Next.js
description: The full stack framework of React application.

title: Vue.js
description: The progressive frontend JavaScript framework.

title: Angular
description: The JavaScript framework, both the current Angular or older Angular.js version.

title: JavaScript UI Libraries/Frameworks
description: The other JavaScript frontend libraries and frameworks (desktop or mobile) such as Electron, Svelte, Ember.js, NativeScript, Cordova, Xamarin.

title: Redux
description: The popular state management library. Including its middlewares such as logger, Redux Thunk, Redux Saga, and others.

title: REST API
description: The mechanism to exchange data via HTTP request and response. Including its tools like cURL, Postman, and Insomnia. Or standards like HTTPS and HTTP/2.

title: GraphQL
description: The modern alternative of REST API. Including its tools like Apollo, urql, Relay, and Hasura.

title: Other APIs
description: The general discussions on other APIs such as WebSocket, Socket.IO, WebRTC, gRPC, Pub/Sub, SSE (Server-Sent Events), and others.

title: Express.js
description: The most popular Node.js backend/server framework. Including its middlewares such as parsers, Helmet, and Passport. Or derivatives like Feathers, Sails.js, Nest, and others.

title: Node.js Libraries and Frameworks
description: The other Node.js backend, server, or full stack libraries and frameworks such as LoopBack, Hapi, Fastify, Apollo, RedwoodJS, KeystoneJS, AdonisJs, Meteor, and others.

title: Database
description: The general database discussions, either SQL or NoSQL. Including ORMs and ODMS such as Prisma, Knex, Sequelize, and Mongoose. Also other DBMS such as SQLite, Firebase, Realm, Redis, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, FaunaDB, and others.

title: MongoDB
description: The most popular NoSQL database.

title: MySQL
description: The most popular SQL database. Including variant like MariaDB.

title: PostgreSQL
description: The other most popular SQL database.

title: Security
description: The generic security discussions. Including authentication, authorization, OAuth, token, JWT, cookies, browser storage, 2FA/MFA, and others.

title: Docker
description: The most popular containerization platform. Including Kubernetes.

title: Testing
description: The generic testing discussions. Including Jest, Mocha, Chai, Cypress, testing-library, Puppeteer, and others.

title: APM
description: The APM (Application Performance Monitoring) and reporting such as Sentry, New Relic, Splunk, Datadog, and others.

title: Infrastructure and Servers
description: The variety of heavy infra and server-related discussions. Including things for IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service) like OS (Operating System), PM2, Nginx, Apache, certbot, monitoring, and others. Or packaged stack like LAMP-like variants.

title: Google Cloud Platform
description: The infra from Google.

title: Amazon Web Services
description: The infra from Amazon.

title: Microsoft Azure
description: The infra from Microsoft.

title: CI/CD
description: The practice of Continuous Integration and Deployment (CI/CD) of software craftmanship. Inlcuding tools like Circle CI, Jenkins, Travis CI, and others.

title: Accessibility
description: To make sure our website and application is accessible for everyone to use. Including internationalization, localization, dark mode, motion, voice interface, chat interface, and more.

title: AR and VR
description: Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) stuffs. Including Oculus, Daydream, and others.

title: AI and ML
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML). Including libraries such as TensorFlow.

title: Data Science and Business Intelligence
description: Data science (DS) and Business Intelligence (BI) discussions. Including tools like Metabase.

title: Game Design and Development
description: Game design and development-related stuffs. Including Unity 3D, Unreal Engine, Phaser, and others.

title: Blockchain and Crypto
description: Blockchain and cryptocurrency-related discussions. Including Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other derivatives.

title: Project and Product Management
description: The way of handling project and product development for teams. Including waterfall, Agile, Scrum, XP, and others.

title: Others
description: The other uncategorized discussions such as feedbacks and bug reports.
